page.title: 15Social Attitudes
page.content:
Local News items: Week to 26 July 1985
Planning: There were several schemes for new developments, which caused objections,like a DIY Superstore on the outskirts of the City; the Mayor called for "No further changes yet",to avoid too rapid development of Truro. Recreation: Councillors want more facilities for young people, but granting a full licence to a Wine Bar would encourage teenage drinking. The City Hall: How should it be developed? For recreation? As shops? At present it is a financial burden. Health hazards: Drugs are one of the biggest problems, but not as bad as in larger urban areas. Dogs fouling in public places causes much concern. The Truro Pro-Dog Group have called for dog toilet facilities.
